page.title: 04 LINLATHEN HOUSE
page.content: Grahams of Fintry continued to hold the property near Dundee until it was sold in this century to the late {Thomas Erskine.}Linlathen used to be called Fintry until Thomas Erskine changed the name to the ESTATE of LINLATHEN.It was bombed in{WORLD {WAR I1.}Polish armies stayed there in 1939_45.The iron bridge is made from cast iron.Linlathen House stands on the bow of a steep,sloping bank rising from the Dighty Burn.It's on the north side of the stream.Lilac cottage is the main entrance to the gardens which have vegetables,flowers, apple,pear and peach trees and they also have bee_hives.
